intro: Prunus crossotolepis, commonly known as the Tibetan cherry, is a species of flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub that typically grows in high-altitude regions. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers in the spring, followed by edible berries that are used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a serrated margin. The botanical features of Prunus crossotolepis make it an important species in the study of alpine flora.
